properties.long desc*: The state of Victoria has a long history fire-caused disasters. Bushfires devastated Victorias bushlands long before European settlement but the earliest recorded bushfire was on 6 February 1851 or the Black Thursday, claiming at least 10 lives. Other severe catastropic fires were up to follow - like Ash Wednesday (16/02/1983) or Black Saturday (07/02/2009 -173 deaths) - and embedded this threat in collective memory structures of the local population.

In his second expedition of the Canadian arctic from 1825-27, the British explorer John Franklin was successful in surveying a long stretch of the Arctic shoreline, from the Mackenzie River westward to Return Reef and eastward to the mouth of the Coppermine, establishing Fort Franklin at the Great Bear Lake.
properties.short desc*: John Franklin explores the Canadian Arctic region
